result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Summary ($600 to be collected through probation on case #15CF112)

11:34 a.m. Defendant David A. King in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF112, 15CF111 and 14CM311 being heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 15CF112 ct 1 - Deferred Judgment. 15CF112 cts 2, 3, 4, 11, & 12 I/S sentence 9 mo jail -stay and 3 yr probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF112 Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, and 12 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF112 Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, and 12 .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
15CF111, 14CM311, 15CF112 Counts 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 13 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION***** 
15CF112 Count 1: Deferred Pros
15CF112 Cts 2
I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment. - stayed
36 months   Probation, concurrent
Conditions:
Obtain diploma, HSED or GED.
 Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Letter to all victims, give to agent first written within 45 days.
No contact with all victims listed in the complaints including read-in victims, except for the letter of apology.
No contact with all co-defendants, EAM and CGR.
Pay restitution of 15CF112 $414.93 and for 15CF111 $600.00.
Early discharge, if successfully completes and Agent recommends.
Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.

15CF112 ct 3: I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment. - stayed
36 months   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.

15CF112 ct 4: I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment. - stayed
36 months   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.

15CF112 ct 11  I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment. - stayed
36 months   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.

15CF112 ct 12: I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment. - stayed
36 months   Probation, concurrent
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.
Defendant Record Update   - original filed in 15CF111

Defendant David A. King in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF111 and 15CF112.
9:03 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
Case to be Pre-ried as of today's date and report to be filed with the Court.
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Defendant David A. King not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF111, 15CF112

Atty Knaapen indicates he had received an email from Atty McFarland.  He had filed written waivers.  Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Covers both 15CF111 and 15CF112.

Defendant David A. King in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF111, 15CF112  

15CF111:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

15CF112:
